title: Nvidia wants 10Gbps HBM4 to blunt AMD’s MI450, report claims — company said to be pushing suppliers for more bandwidth
summary: Nvidia is reportedly pressing its memory vendors to push beyond JEDEC’s official HBM4 baseline, reportedly requesting 10Gb/s-per-pin stacks for its 2026 Vera Rubin platform.

title: $115 million ransomware hacker arrested over extortion attacks — Scattered Spider alumnus allegedly involved in over 120 computer network intrusions targeting 47 U.S. entities
summary: A British National has been arrested and accused of helping to facilitate over $155 million in exploitation and blackmail attacks against U.S. and British companies. The 19-year-old has ties to the infamous Scattered Spider hacking group.

title: I have the most luxurious standing desk imaginable, but I can't quite bring myself to game while standing
summary: I have a $1,000 sit-stand desk designed for gaming, so why do I never stand up to game?

title: Nvidia drops a cool $900 million on Enfabrica tech and hiring its CEO, report claims — AI networking chip company boasts capacity to connect 100,000 GPUs together
summary: Nvidia has hired the CEO of AI networking chip company, Enfabrica, alongside a number of other staff for $900 million. The deal will also give Nvidia a license to use the unique technology, which the developers claim can link up 100,000 GPUs.

title: Here's how I installed Windows 11 using a nano-sized 2.4GB ISO — final install weighed in at a mere 8.36GB, two-thirds the size of a normal Windows install, courtesy of Nano11 Builder
summary: Using some custom scripts and a base Windows 11 ISO install image, just how much can you remove and keep a functional operating system?

title: Huawei unveils Atlas 950 SuperCluster — promises 1 ZettaFLOPS FP4 performance and features hundreds of thousands of 950DT APUs
summary: Huawei has outlined its roadmap for Zettascale AI systems that will rely on hundreds of thousands and then millions of AI accelerators.

title: Ditching Windows 10? Here's how I installed Windows 11, removed AI, and stripped out unnecessary features using Flyoobe
summary: Flyoobe offers a convenient way to install Windows 11 on computers that don’t meet Microsoft’s requirements. But that’s not all. Flyoobe can also be used to tweak Windows 11, remove AI components, and get the best Windows 11 experience on even elderly hardware.

title: Football's ticket black market - are fans being ripped off?
summary: A BBC investigation exposes just how easy it is to buy Premier League tickets on the black market.

title: Teams at Nvidia and Intel have been working in secret on jointly developed processors for a year — 'The Trump administration has no involvement in this partnership at all'
summary: Intel and Nvidia have quietly spent the past year co-developing custom x86 processors and SoCs for data center and client PCs with deep architectural collaboration across three joint teams.

title: xAI's new gas turbine facility gets halfway to Elon Musk's 1-gigawatt 'AI factory' goal
summary: According to a new report from SemiAnalysis, Elon Musk’s AI startup already has 460MW of natural gas generation either installed or under construction.

title: I managed to snag a Core i5 CPU for $10, because someone scammed Amazon out of an i7-14700
summary: Someone scammed Amazon out of a Core i7-14700, but I got a 13th Gen Core i5 for $10 as a result.

title: Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 shows up in Geekbench with a score of 3,831 — upcoming chip catches Apple's just-launched A19 Pro, beats desktop chips on single-core perf
summary: A Xiaomi device in Geekbench packing a Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 chip posted a single-thread score of 3831 points.

title: Humble & sweet, but a lion - the story of the first female £1m player
summary: Meet the person behind women's football's first £1m player, Arsenal's new superstar forward Olivia Smith.

title: 'People looked at me like I was a something, not someone'
summary: In a candid interview, World Cup winner Heather Fisher discusses losing her hair and the struggle she had with her identity.

title: 'He fixes what needs fixing' - why Raducanu turned to Nadal's ex-coach
summary: Emma Raducanu recently appointed another full-time coach in Spaniard Francisco Roig - BBC Sport speaks to those who know him best.

title: 'He has made young players dream' - the making of Liverpool icon Salah
summary: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

title: Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in fight in US
summary: The story of Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in a sanctioned fight in the United States.

title: How Hampton overcame odds to become England's number one
summary: Hannah Hampton on overcoming a serious eye condition to rise to become England's number one goalkeeper at Euro 2025.
